data.short_desc: US forces have destroyed over 80 one-way attack drones and six ballistic missiles launched from Iran and Yemen intended to strike Israel amid ongoing tensions in the region following Iran's unprecedented attack against Israel. In a retaliatory attack on Sunday, Iran fired more than 300 missiles and drones directly towards Israel to avenge an airstrike on its consulate in Syria earlier this month that killed seven Revolutionary Guards and six Syrian civilians. The attack lasted for five hours and 99 per cent of drones and missiles were intercepted by Israel. The Israeli military said that it was on high alert and monitoring all targets. Stay with indiatoday.in for the latest updates on the Iran-Israel tensions.
data.title: Iran-Israel tensions LIVE updates: US forces destroy 80 drones, 6 missiles launched from Iran, Yemen
data.sub_title: US forces destroy 80 drones, 6 missiles launched from Iran, Yemen
data.image_caption: An incoming attack by Iranian drones and ballistic missiles poses the latest challenge to Israel’s air defence system, which already has been working overtime amid the six-month war against Hamas. (AP Photo)

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Sunday called the Foreign Ministers in Jordan, Saudi Arabia, Turkey and Egypt, while Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin spoke with his Saudi and Israeli counterparts amid escalating tensions in the region after Iran's attack on Israel.During their calls, Blinken and Austin emphasised on the need to avoid further escalation in the region and reaffirmed Washington's "ironclad" commitment to the security of Israel, the PTI news agency reported.Meanwhile, US President Joe Biden reached out to the Congressional leaders on Sunday and "discussed the urgent need for the House of Representatives to pass the national security supplemental as soon as possible”, the White House said.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
US Secretary of State Antony Blinken on Sunday called the Foreign Ministers in Jordan, Saudi Arabia, Turkey and Egypt, while Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin spoke with his Saudi and Israeli counterparts amid escalating tensions in the region after Iran's attack on Israel.

During their calls, Blinken and Austin emphasised on the need to avoid further escalation in the region and reaffirmed Washington's "ironclad" commitment to the security of Israel, the PTI news agency reported.

Meanwhile, US President Joe Biden reached out to the Congressional leaders on Sunday and "discussed the urgent need for the House of Representatives to pass the national security supplemental as soon as possible”, the White House said.
blog_content.title: Antony Blinken calls counterparts in Turkey, Egypt, Jordan

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: The Israeli military on Monday lifted a series of restrictions on public activities that were imposed before Iran's missile and drone attack on Sunday. It said children can also return to schools.Late Saturday, the Israeli military’s Home Front command cancelled schools and restricted the size of public gatherings as a safety precaution, the Associated Press reported.The Home Front Command says the restrictions were lifted at midnight.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
The Israeli military on Monday lifted a series of restrictions on public activities that were imposed before Iran's missile and drone attack on Sunday. It said children can also return to schools.

Late Saturday, the Israeli military’s Home Front command cancelled schools and restricted the size of public gatherings as a safety precaution, the Associated Press reported.

The Home Front Command says the restrictions were lifted at midnight.
blog_content.title: Israeli military lifts restrictions

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Iran gave its neighbouring countries and the US a 72-hour notice that it would launch missile and drone strikes at Israel on Sunday, Iranian Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian said. But American officials have denied this, saying that Iran sent the US a message only after the strikes began, and the intent was to be "highly destructive".The Turkish Foreign Ministry has also said that it had spoken to both Washington and Tehran before the attack, adding it had conveyed messages as an intermediary to be sure reactions were proportionate, Reuters reported.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Iran gave its neighbouring countries and the US a 72-hour notice that it would launch missile and drone strikes at Israel on Sunday, Iranian Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian said. But American officials have denied this, saying that Iran sent the US a message only after the strikes began, and the intent was to be "highly destructive".

The Turkish Foreign Ministry has also said that it had spoken to both Washington and Tehran before the attack, adding it had conveyed messages as an intermediary to be sure reactions were proportionate, Reuters reported.
blog_content.title: Iran says it warned before Israel attack

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: The US Central Command on Monday said American forces "successfully engaged and destroyed" over 80 one-way attack uncrewed aerial vehicles and at least six ballistic missiles intended to strike Israel from Iran and Yemen. The launches took place on Saturday and Sunday morning.Defense of Israel Activities UpdateOn April 13 and the morning of April 14, U.S. Central Command (CENTCOM) forces, supported by U.S. European Command destroyers, successfully engaged and destroyed more than 80 one-way attack uncrewed aerial vehicles (OWA UAV) and at least six… pic.twitter.com/QYyk01o1Vs— U.S. Central Command (@CENTCOM) April 14, 2024
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
The US Central Command on Monday said American forces "successfully engaged and destroyed" over 80 one-way attack uncrewed aerial vehicles and at least six ballistic missiles intended to strike Israel from Iran and Yemen. The launches took place on Saturday and Sunday morning.

Defense of Israel Activities Update

On April 13 and the morning of April 14, U.S. Central Command (CENTCOM) forces, supported by U.S. European Command destroyers, successfully engaged and destroyed more than 80 one-way attack uncrewed aerial vehicles (OWA UAV) and at least six… pic.twitter.com/QYyk01o1Vs

— U.S. Central Command (@CENTCOM) April 14, 2024
blog_content.title: US military destroys drones fired from Iran, Yemen

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: The Israeli military said the country remains on high alert following Iran's unprecedented attack on Sunday when it launched more than 300 missiles and drones directly towards Israeli territory."We are still on high alert and assessing the situation," Reuters news agency quoted Rear Admiral Daniel Hagari as saying in a televised statement on Sunday. "Over the last two hours we approved operational plans for both offensive and defensive action."The Israeli military said the armed forces had shot down more than 99 per cent of the Iranian drones and missiles and were discussing follow-up options.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
The Israeli military said the country remains on high alert following Iran's unprecedented attack on Sunday when it launched more than 300 missiles and drones directly towards Israeli territory.

"We are still on high alert and assessing the situation," Reuters news agency quoted Rear Admiral Daniel Hagari as saying in a televised statement on Sunday. "Over the last two hours we approved operational plans for both offensive and defensive action."

The Israeli military said the armed forces had shot down more than 99 per cent of the Iranian drones and missiles and were discussing follow-up options.
blog_content.title: Israel remains on high alert

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Unequivocally condemning in the strongest terms Iran’s direct and unprecedented attack against Israel, the G-7 leaders on Sunday said the development risks provoking an uncontrollable regional escalation even as the UN Security Council decided to convene an emergency meeting discuss the issue.
blog_content.desc_withhtml: Unequivocally condemning in the strongest terms Iran’s direct and unprecedented attack against Israel, the G-7 leaders on Sunday said the development risks provoking an uncontrollable regional escalation even as the UN Security Council decided to convene an emergency meeting discuss the issue.
blog_content.title: Iran attack on Israel risks provoking uncontrollable regional escalation, say G7 leaders

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Iranian Ambassador to the United Nations, Saeid Iravani, told the Security Council on Sunday that the Islamic republic was exercising its "inherent right to self-defense" in its unprecedented attack on Israel. "Iran's operation was entirely in the exercise of Iran's inherent right to self-defense, as outlined in Article 51 of the Charter of the United Nations and recognized by international law. These concluded action was necessary and proportionate. It was precise and only targeted military objectives and carried out carefully to minimize the potential for escalation and prevent civilian harm."
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Iranian Ambassador to the United Nations, Saeid Iravani, told the Security Council on Sunday that the Islamic republic was exercising its "inherent right to self-defense" in its unprecedented attack on Israel. 

"Iran's operation was entirely in the exercise of Iran's inherent right to self-defense, as outlined in Article 51 of the Charter of the United Nations and recognized by international law. These concluded action was necessary and proportionate. It was precise and only targeted military objectives and carried out carefully to minimize the potential for escalation and prevent civilian harm."
blog_content.title: Iran tells UN Israel attack was 'self defense,' 'necessary'

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: "Even while under attack from Iran, we have not lost sight—not for one moment—of our critical mission in Gaza to rescue our hostages from the hands of Iran’s-proxy Hamas," IDF Spokesperson RAdm. Daniel Hagari said.
blog_content.desc_withhtml: "Even while under attack from Iran, we have not lost sight—not for one moment—of our critical mission in Gaza to rescue our hostages from the hands of Iran’s-proxy Hamas," IDF Spokesperson RAdm. Daniel Hagari said.
blog_content.title: Even under attack from Iran, we have not lost sight: IDF spokesperson

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Israel's UN envoy on Sunday urged the Security Council to impose "all possible sanctions" against Iran after the Islamic republic's unprecedented attack against Israel.
blog_content.desc_withhtml: Israel's UN envoy on Sunday urged the Security Council to impose "all possible sanctions" against Iran after the Islamic republic's unprecedented attack against Israel.
blog_content.title: At UN, Israel urges all possible sanctions against Iran

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: House Speaker Mike Johnson said Sunday he will try to advance wartime aid for Israel this week as he attempts the difficult task of winning House approval for a national security package that also includes funding for Ukraine and allies in Asia.
blog_content.desc_withhtml: House Speaker Mike Johnson said Sunday he will try to advance wartime aid for Israel this week as he attempts the difficult task of winning House approval for a national security package that also includes funding for Ukraine and allies in Asia.
blog_content.title: House Speaker Mike Johnson says 'will push for aid to Israel, Ukraine this week'

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: United Nations Secretary General Antonio Guterres warned the international community Sunday against deeper descent into conflict, addressing the Security Council during a meeting over Iran's weekend attack on Israel. "Neither the region nor the world can afford more war," Guterres said. "The Middle East is on the brink," he told the Security Council. (Inputs from AFP)
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
United Nations Secretary General Antonio Guterres warned the international community Sunday against deeper descent into conflict, addressing the Security Council during a meeting over Iran's weekend attack on Israel. 

"Neither the region nor the world can afford more war," Guterres said. 

"The Middle East is on the brink," he told the Security Council. 

(Inputs from AFP)
blog_content.title: Middle East, world cannot 'afford more war': UN chief

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Permanent Representative of the Syrian Arab Republic to the United Nations, Koussay Aldahhak, speaks to members of Security Council during a meeting on the situation in the Middle East at UN headquarters in New York City.
blog_content.desc_withhtml: Permanent Representative of the Syrian Arab Republic to the United Nations, Koussay Aldahhak, speaks to members of Security Council during a meeting on the situation in the Middle East at UN headquarters in New York City.
blog_content.title: United Nations Security Council on situation in Middle East

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Turkish, Jordanian and Iraqi officials said on Sunday Iran gave wide notice days before Saturday's drone and missile attack on Israel, allowing mass casualties and rampant escalation to be averted, but a US official denied this.(Inputs from Reuters)
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Turkish, Jordanian and Iraqi officials said on Sunday Iran gave wide notice days before Saturday's drone and missile attack on Israel, allowing mass casualties and rampant escalation to be averted, but a US official denied this.

(Inputs from Reuters)
blog_content.title: Iranian notice of attack may have dampened escalation risks

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Sunday held a telephonic conversation with his Israeli counterpart, Israel Katz, and shared India's concerns over the situation arising out of the Iran-Israel hostilities.
blog_content.desc_withhtml: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Sunday held a telephonic conversation with his Israeli counterpart, Israel Katz, and shared India's concerns over the situation arising out of the Iran-Israel hostilities.
blog_content.title: S Jaishankar speaks to Israeli counterpart: 'To stay in touch'

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Iran's attack on Israel gives Joe Biden a familiar dilemma, but on steroids -- how to balance support for a difficult ally while preventing the nightmare scenario of a wider war?Tensions with Benjamin Netanyahu over Israel's war on Gaza were papered over as the US president offered "ironclad" support, including shooting down Iranian drones.But the White House has made it clear it does not want further escalation following Iran's unprecedented assault and will not support an Israeli counterattack that could trigger a full-blown regional conflict.(Inputs from AFP)
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Iran's attack on Israel gives Joe Biden a familiar dilemma, but on steroids -- how to balance support for a difficult ally while preventing the nightmare scenario of a wider war?

Tensions with Benjamin Netanyahu over Israel's war on Gaza were papered over as the US president offered "ironclad" support, including shooting down Iranian drones.

But the White House has made it clear it does not want further escalation following Iran's unprecedented assault and will not support an Israeli counterattack that could trigger a full-blown regional conflict.

(Inputs from AFP)
blog_content.title: Biden in 'very tough spot' trying to stop Middle East escalation

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: The United States on Sunday said it will not join any Israeli counterattack on Iran, with President Joe Biden warning Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to "think carefully" about any escalation.The White House said Biden did not want a wider war after helping key ally Israel repel a massive aerial attack by Tehran -- itself in retaliation for a presumed Israeli strike that killed an Iranian general in Damascus. (Inputs from AFP)
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
The United States on Sunday said it will not join any Israeli counterattack on Iran, with President Joe Biden warning Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to "think carefully" about any escalation.

The White House said Biden did not want a wider war after helping key ally Israel repel a massive aerial attack by Tehran -- itself in retaliation for a presumed Israeli strike that killed an Iranian general in Damascus. 

(Inputs from AFP)
blog_content.title: US rules out joining Israeli attack on Iran

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar today said he spoke with his Iranian counterpart Hossein Amir-Abdollahian and discussed the situation in West Asia after Tehran attacked Israel with missiles and drones.Jaishankar also discussed the release of 17 Indian crew members on a cargo ship seized by Iranian military on Saturday."Spoke to Iranian FM this evening. Took up the release of 17 Indian crew members of MSC Aries. Discussed the current situation in the region. Stressed the importance of avoiding escalation, exercising restraint and returning to diplomacy. Agreed to remain in touch," Mr Jaishankar said on X.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar today said he spoke with his Iranian counterpart Hossein Amir-Abdollahian and discussed the situation in West Asia after Tehran attacked Israel with missiles and drones.

Jaishankar also discussed the release of 17 Indian crew members on a cargo ship seized by Iranian military on Saturday.

"Spoke to Iranian FM this evening. Took up the release of 17 Indian crew members of MSC Aries. Discussed the current situation in the region. Stressed the importance of avoiding escalation, exercising restraint and returning to diplomacy. Agreed to remain in touch," Mr Jaishankar said on X.
blog_content.title: Middle East crisis: S Jaishankar speaks to Iranian counterpart, discusses West Asia situation

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: External Affairs Minister (EAM) S Jaishankar on Sunday spoke to his Israeli counterpart Israel Katz to discuss the unprecedented drone and missile attack on the Jewish state by Iran on Saturday night. "Just concluded a conversation with Israel’s Minister of Foreign Affairs Israel Katz. Shared our concern at the developments yesterday. Discussed the larger regional situation. Agreed to stay in touch," Jaishankar said in a post on X (formerly known as Twitter).
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
External Affairs Minister (EAM) S Jaishankar on Sunday spoke to his Israeli counterpart Israel Katz to discuss the unprecedented drone and missile attack on the Jewish state by Iran on Saturday night. 

"Just concluded a conversation with Israel’s Minister of Foreign Affairs Israel Katz. Shared our concern at the developments yesterday. Discussed the larger regional situation. Agreed to stay in touch," Jaishankar said in a post on X (formerly known as Twitter).
blog_content.title: Middle East crisis: S Jaishankar speaks to Israeli counterpart, agrees to be in touch

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Lebanese terrorist group Hezbollah on Sunday praised Iran's attack on Israel, describing it as a "brave" decision. Iran-backed Hezbollah added in a statement that Iran had exercised its legal rights despite "threats, intimidation and pressure."(With inputs from Reuters.)
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Lebanese terrorist group Hezbollah on Sunday praised Iran's attack on Israel, describing it as a "brave" decision. Iran-backed Hezbollah added in a statement that Iran had exercised its legal rights despite "threats, intimidation and pressure."

(With inputs from Reuters.)
blog_content.title: Middle East crisis: Lebanese terror group praises Iranian attack on Israel as 'brave' decision

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Turkish Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan told his U.S. counterpart Antony Blinken in a call on Sunday that Ankara was worried about the potential spread and escalation of the crisis in the Middle East after Iran's attacks on Israel, a Turkish diplomatic source said.Fidan told Blinken that the root cause of the crisis in the region was the war in Gaza, and that an immediate ceasefire and unhindered access of humanitarian aid was needed in the enclave, the source said.Fidan also urged countries with influence over Israel to send the "correct messages" to prevent further escalating regional tensions, the source added.(With inputs from Reuters.)
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Turkish Foreign Minister Hakan Fidan told his U.S. counterpart Antony Blinken in a call on Sunday that Ankara was worried about the potential spread and escalation of the crisis in the Middle East after Iran's attacks on Israel, a Turkish diplomatic source said.

Fidan told Blinken that the root cause of the crisis in the region was the war in Gaza, and that an immediate ceasefire and unhindered access of humanitarian aid was needed in the enclave, the source said.

Fidan also urged countries with influence over Israel to send the "correct messages" to prevent further escalating regional tensions, the source added.

(With inputs from Reuters.)
blog_content.title: Turkey tells US it is worried about escalation of Middle East crisis

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday convened the War Cabinet at the Kirya in Tel Aviv, a day after an unprecedented drone and missile attack by Iran. Iran and its proxies launched 330 missiles and drones on Israel late on Saturday night in retaliation to an alleged attack by Israel on a diplomatic mission of the Islamic Republic in Damascus on April 1 in which several people, including two top commanders, were killed.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu on Sunday convened the War Cabinet at the Kirya in Tel Aviv, a day after an unprecedented drone and missile attack by Iran.

Iran and its proxies launched 330 missiles and drones on Israel late on Saturday night in retaliation to an alleged attack by Israel on a diplomatic mission of the Islamic Republic in Damascus on April 1 in which several people, including two top commanders, were killed.
blog_content.title: Middle East crisis: Israeli PM convenes war cabinet

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: G7 leaders today unanimously condemned Iran's unprecedented attack against Israel and urged that all parties must exercise restraint."We will continue all our efforts to work towards de-escalation. Ending the crisis in Gaza as soon as possible, notably through an immediate ceasefire, will make a difference. The situation in the Middle-East, including Lebanon, will be discussed at the European Council next week," President of the European Council Charles Michel said on X (formerly known as Twitter).
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
G7 leaders today unanimously condemned Iran's unprecedented attack against Israel and urged that all parties must exercise restraint.

"We will continue all our efforts to work towards de-escalation. Ending the crisis in Gaza as soon as possible, notably through an immediate ceasefire, will make a difference. The situation in the Middle-East, including Lebanon, will be discussed at the European Council next week," President of the European Council Charles Michel said on X (formerly known as Twitter).
blog_content.title: Middle East crisis: G7 condemns Iran attack on Israel, calls for restraint

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan writes to External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar seeking immediate intervention and decisive action through diplomatic channels to ensure the safety of Indian nationals who are crew members of the ship MSC Aries, which was seized by Iran's Revolutionary Guards near the Strait of Hormuz."Our collective objective at this point of time is the safe repatriation of all our nationals, including those from Kerala, back to India without any delay. Given the sensitive geopolitical situation surrounding this incident, I urge immediate intervention and decisive action through diplomatic channels," Vijayan said in his letter to Jaishankar.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Kerala Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan writes to External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar seeking immediate intervention and decisive action through diplomatic channels to ensure the safety of Indian nationals who are crew members of the ship MSC Aries, which was seized by Iran's Revolutionary Guards near the Strait of Hormuz.

"Our collective objective at this point of time is the safe repatriation of all our nationals, including those from Kerala, back to India without any delay. Given the sensitive geopolitical situation surrounding this incident, I urge immediate intervention and decisive action through diplomatic channels," Vijayan said in his letter to Jaishankar.
blog_content.title: Middle East crisis: Kerala government seeks safety of Indians detained in Iran

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Israeli airlines said operations were returning to normal on Sunday after an overnight attack by Iranian missiles and drones closed the airspace and led to flight cancellations.Israel reopened its airspace as of 7.30 am (0430 GMT) on Sunday, though flight schedules from Tel Aviv were expected to be affected and travellers were advised to check flight times before going to Ben Gurion International Airport.A graphical representation of air traffic shows airspace over Iran and the neighbouring Middle East at 0000 GMT, April 14, 2024. (Image: Flightradar24.com)(With inputs from Reuters.)
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Israeli airlines said operations were returning to normal on Sunday after an overnight attack by Iranian missiles and drones closed the airspace and led to flight cancellations.

Israel reopened its airspace as of 7.30 am (0430 GMT) on Sunday, though flight schedules from Tel Aviv were expected to be affected and travellers were advised to check flight times before going to Ben Gurion International Airport.

(With inputs from Reuters.)
blog_content.title: Middle East crisis: Israel reopens airspace as airlines cancel flights due to Iran attacks

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Iran informed Turkey in advance of its planned operation against Israel, a Turkish diplomatic source told Reuters on Sunday, adding that the US conveyed to Iran via Ankara that its operation must be "within certain limits".Earlier this week, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken spoke to the Turkish foreign minister to make clear that escalation in the Middle East was not in anyone's interest.(With inputs from Reuters.)
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Iran informed Turkey in advance of its planned operation against Israel, a Turkish diplomatic source told Reuters on Sunday, adding that the US conveyed to Iran via Ankara that its operation must be "within certain limits".

Earlier this week, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken spoke to the Turkish foreign minister to make clear that escalation in the Middle East was not in anyone's interest.

(With inputs from Reuters.)
blog_content.title: Middle East crisis: Iran told Turkey in advance of its operation against Israel

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Israeli war cabinet minister Benny Gantz on Sunday said that the country will "exact a price from Iran" in response to the drone and missile attack - when the "time is right". "We will build a regional coalition and exact the price from Iran in the fashion and timing that is right for us," Gantz said in a statement.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Israeli war cabinet minister Benny Gantz on Sunday said that the country will "exact a price from Iran" in response to the drone and missile attack - when the "time is right". 

"We will build a regional coalition and exact the price from Iran in the fashion and timing that is right for us," Gantz said in a statement.
blog_content.title: Middle East crisis: Israel says it will 'exact price from Iran' when time is right

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Air India on Sunday announced its decision to temporarily suspend flights to Tel Aviv amid escalating tensions between Israel and Iran, news agency PTI reported.An official said that direct flights between Delhi and Tel Aviv will be suspended for now.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Air India on Sunday announced its decision to temporarily suspend flights to Tel Aviv amid escalating tensions between Israel and Iran, news agency PTI reported.

An official said that direct flights between Delhi and Tel Aviv will be suspended for now.
blog_content.title: Middle East crisis: Air India temporarily suspends Tel Aviv flights

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: US President Joe Biden conveyed to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu that the United States would abstain from engaging in any Israeli retaliation against Iran, news agency Reuters reported, quoting CNN and the Wall Street Journal.During his conversation with Netanyahu, Biden indicated that additional action was unwarranted, with senior US officials informing their Israeli counterparts that the US would refrain from joining any offensive response against Iran.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
US President Joe Biden conveyed to Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu that the United States would abstain from engaging in any Israeli retaliation against Iran, news agency Reuters reported, quoting CNN and the Wall Street Journal.

During his conversation with Netanyahu, Biden indicated that additional action was unwarranted, with senior US officials informing their Israeli counterparts that the US would refrain from joining any offensive response against Iran.
blog_content.title: Middle East crisis: Biden says US wouldn't take part in Israeli counter against Iran

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: The 7-year-old girl, the sole individual in Israel to suffer severe injuries during the recent Iranian attack overnight Saturday-Sunday, continues to fight for her life at Soroka Medical Center in Beersheba, The Times of Israel reported.Hospital reports indicate that the girl underwent surgery for a critical head injury and is currently under intensive care in the pediatric unit. Her injuries occurred when debris from a intercepted ballistic missile struck her family's residence in a Bedouin community near Arad in the southern Negev area.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
The 7-year-old girl, the sole individual in Israel to suffer severe injuries during the recent Iranian attack overnight Saturday-Sunday, continues to fight for her life at Soroka Medical Center in Beersheba, The Times of Israel reported.

Hospital reports indicate that the girl underwent surgery for a critical head injury and is currently under intensive care in the pediatric unit. 

Her injuries occurred when debris from a intercepted ballistic missile struck her family's residence in a Bedouin community near Arad in the southern Negev area.
blog_content.title: Middle East crisis: Minor Israeli girl hurt in Iranian attack remains critical

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Israeli envoy to India Naor Gilon, during an interview with news agency ANI, emphasised that Indian workers "will be as safe as the Israeli population" since his country treats Indian workers as part of the Israeli population."The workers are no different than other Israelis. As you saw last night, there was a huge effort by Israel, and we were able to protect our civilians, which we will do in the future. Since we treat Indian workers as part of the Israeli population, they will be as safe as the Israeli population. We are doing maximum to protect everyone in Israel", said Ambassador Gilon on Sunday.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Israeli envoy to India Naor Gilon, during an interview with news agency ANI, emphasised that Indian workers "will be as safe as the Israeli population" since his country treats Indian workers as part of the Israeli population.

"The workers are no different than other Israelis. As you saw last night, there was a huge effort by Israel, and we were able to protect our civilians, which we will do in the future. Since we treat Indian workers as part of the Israeli population, they will be as safe as the Israeli population. We are doing maximum to protect everyone in Israel", said Ambassador Gilon on Sunday.
blog_content.title: Middle East crisis: Israeli envoy assures safety of Indian workers

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Reaffirming America’s "ironclad commitment" to the Jewish nation, US President Joe Biden on Sunday vowed to convene a meeting of the G-7 leaders to develop a coordinated response to Iranian air attack on Israel. "Tomorrow, I will convene my fellow G-7 leaders to coordinate a united diplomatic response to Iran’s brazen attack. My team will engage with their counterparts across the region. And we will stay in close touch with Israel’s leaders. And while we have not seen attacks on our forces or facilities today, we will remain vigilant to all threats and will not hesitate to take all necessary action to protect our people," Biden said.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Reaffirming America’s "ironclad commitment" to the Jewish nation, US President Joe Biden on Sunday vowed to convene a meeting of the G-7 leaders to develop a coordinated response to Iranian air attack on Israel. 

"Tomorrow, I will convene my fellow G-7 leaders to coordinate a united diplomatic response to Iran’s brazen attack. My team will engage with their counterparts across the region. And we will stay in close touch with Israel’s leaders. And while we have not seen attacks on our forces or facilities today, we will remain vigilant to all threats and will not hesitate to take all necessary action to protect our people," Biden said.
blog_content.title: Middle East crisis: Joe Biden to convene G-7 meet in response to Iranian attack

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday condemned Iran's drone and missile attack on Israel and called for immediate efforts to prevent a further escalation in the Middle East conflict."Iran's actions threaten the entire region and the world, just as Russia's actions threaten a larger conflict, and the obvious collaboration between the two regimes in spreading terror must face a resolute and united response from the world," he wrote on social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter).
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday condemned Iran's drone and missile attack on Israel and called for immediate efforts to prevent a further escalation in the Middle East conflict.

"Iran's actions threaten the entire region and the world, just as Russia's actions threaten a larger conflict, and the obvious collaboration between the two regimes in spreading terror must face a resolute and united response from the world," he wrote on social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter).
blog_content.title: Middle East crisis: Ukraine's Zelenskyy condemns attack on Israel, links it with 'Russia's action'

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Soon after Israel's attack "still in the cards" assertion, Iran warned Israel and the United States on Sunday of a "much larger response" if there is any retaliation for its mass drone and missile attack.Israeli Defence Minister Yoav Gallant said despite thwarting the attack, the military campaign was not over and "we must be prepared for every scenario".Israel's Channel 12 TV cited an unnamed Israeli official overnight as saying there would be a "significant response" to the attack.(With inputs from Reuters.)
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Soon after Israel's attack "still in the cards" assertion, Iran warned Israel and the United States on Sunday of a "much larger response" if there is any retaliation for its mass drone and missile attack.

Israeli Defence Minister Yoav Gallant said despite thwarting the attack, the military campaign was not over and "we must be prepared for every scenario".

Israel's Channel 12 TV cited an unnamed Israeli official overnight as saying there would be a "significant response" to the attack.

(With inputs from Reuters.)
blog_content.title: Middle East crisis: Iran warns Israel, US against retaliation

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak asserted that British military jets successfully intercepted drones launched by Iran during its assault on Israel. He called for "calm heads to prevail" to prevent further escalation of the conflict."Iran's attack last night was a dangerous and unnecessary escalation," he said. "I can confirm that our planes did shoot down a number of Iranian attack drones. If this attack had been successful, the fallout for regional stability would be hard to overstate. We stand by the security of Israel and the wider region, which is of course important for our security here at home, too. What we now need is for calm heads to prevail," UK PM added.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak asserted that British military jets successfully intercepted drones launched by Iran during its assault on Israel. He called for "calm heads to prevail" to prevent further escalation of the conflict.

"Iran's attack last night was a dangerous and unnecessary escalation," he said.

"I can confirm that our planes did shoot down a number of Iranian attack drones. If this attack had been successful, the fallout for regional stability would be hard to overstate. We stand by the security of Israel and the wider region, which is of course important for our security here at home, too. What we now need is for calm heads to prevail," UK PM added.
blog_content.title: Middle East crisis: British jets shot down Iranian drones, says Rishi Sunak

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Israeli Foreign Minister Israel Katz told Israeli radio on Sunday morning that an Israeli attack against Iran is "still in the cards"."If Iran attacks Israel, Israel will attack Iran. That assertion remains valid. We authorized the relevant forum headed by the prime minister to promote this topic and I trust them to make the right and appropriate decisions," he said in an interview for Army Radio. "All the considerations are taken into account," The Wall Street Journal quoted Katz as saying.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Israeli Foreign Minister Israel Katz told Israeli radio on Sunday morning that an Israeli attack against Iran is "still in the cards".

"If Iran attacks Israel, Israel will attack Iran. That assertion remains valid. We authorized the relevant forum headed by the prime minister to promote this topic and I trust them to make the right and appropriate decisions," he said in an interview for Army Radio. "All the considerations are taken into account," The Wall Street Journal quoted Katz as saying.
blog_content.title: Middle East crisis: Israel's Foreign Minister says reprisal against Iran is possible

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Thousands of Iranians took to the streets of Iran early Sunday in a show of support for the unprecedented drone and missile attack under way against arch foe Israel. "Death to Israel!" and "Death to America!" chanted demonstrators in Tehran's Palestine Square shortly after the Revolutionary Guards announced the launch of Operation Honest Promise. A mural saying "the next slap is fiercer" was unveiled in the square where a huge banner has hung for days calling, in Hebrew, for Israelis to "take shelter".(With inputs from AFP.)
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Thousands of Iranians took to the streets of Iran early Sunday in a show of support for the unprecedented drone and missile attack under way against arch foe Israel. 

"Death to Israel!" and "Death to America!" chanted demonstrators in Tehran's Palestine Square shortly after the Revolutionary Guards announced the launch of Operation Honest Promise. 

A mural saying "the next slap is fiercer" was unveiled in the square where a huge banner has hung for days calling, in Hebrew, for Israelis to "take shelter".

(With inputs from AFP.)
blog_content.title: Middle East crisis: Thousands gather in Iran in show of support for attack on Israel

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Iran on Sunday urged Israel not to retaliate militarily to an unprecedented attack overnight, which Tehran presented as a justified response to a deadly strike on its consulate building in Damascus."The matter can be deemed concluded," Iran's mission to the United Nations said in a post on social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) just a few hours after the start of the operation late Saturday."However, should the Israeli regime make another mistake, Iran's response will be considerably more severe," the Iranian mission warned.
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Iran on Sunday urged Israel not to retaliate militarily to an unprecedented attack overnight, which Tehran presented as a justified response to a deadly strike on its consulate building in Damascus.

"The matter can be deemed concluded," Iran's mission to the United Nations said in a post on social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) just a few hours after the start of the operation late Saturday.

"However, should the Israeli regime make another mistake, Iran's response will be considerably more severe," the Iranian mission warned.
blog_content.title: Middle East crisis: Iran says retaliation 'concluded', warns Israel not to respond

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: The Indian mission in Israel on Sunday issued a fresh "important advisory" for its nationals after attacks on the Jewish State by Iran with hundreds of projectiles, advising them to stay calm and adhere to safety protocols."In light of the recent events in the region, all Indian nationals in Israel are advised to stay calm and adhere to the safety protocols issued by the local authorities," the Indian mission said in the "important advisory" advisory posted on its social media handles."The Embassy is closely monitoring the situation, and it is in touch with the Israeli authorities and Indian community members to ensure the safety of all our nationals," it added.

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said Iran's attack on Israel late Saturday was a matter of deep concern as the situation escalated in the Middle East. He also said India had particular stakes in the region."For sometimes, we have been concerned about the situation there starting with the October 7 attack on Israel, escalating into other dimensions and other zones, which is deeply worrying. Right now, we have advised people not to travel to Israel and Iran," he told India Today TV in an exclusive interview.

blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Russia's Aeroflot airline diverted a Tehran-bound flight from Moscow on Saturday. The airline also postponed a number of flights to Egypt and the UAE.

United Airlines canceled Saturday’s planned flight from Newark to Tel Aviv due to restrictions on Israeli airspace.

Kuwait Airways diverted all incoming and outgoing flights away from "areas of tension" in view of the security situation in the region.

Israel El Al Airlines cancelled 15 flights scheduled for Saturday and Sunday.
blog_content.title: Air travel disrupted amid escalation in Middle East

blog_content.desc_withouthtml: Iran on Sunday launched drones towards Israel. The attack comes nearly two weeks after an air strike on the Iranian consulate in Damascus, Syria. Iran had blamed Israel for the attack and warned of retaliation. Hours before the drone attack, Iran had seized a cargo ship linked to Israel near the Strait of Hormuz.Meanwhile, the US vowed support to the Israel. The US said it stands by Israel and will "support their defense".
blog_content.desc_withhtml:
Iran on Sunday launched drones towards Israel. The attack comes nearly two weeks after an air strike on the Iranian consulate in Damascus, Syria. Iran had blamed Israel for the attack and warned of retaliation. 

Hours before the drone attack, Iran had seized a cargo ship linked to Israel near the Strait of Hormuz.

Meanwhile, the US vowed support to the Israel. The US said it stands by Israel and will "support their defense".
blog_content.title: Iran launches attack on Israel
